qas.question: In what year did the Puritans survey New Haven Harbor?
From what colony did the original 500 Puritan settlers originate?
Who was the religious leader of the original Puritan settlers?
In what year did the original 500 Puritan settlers arrive in the New Haven harbor area?
From what native tribe did the original Puritan settlers purchase land in exchange for the offer of providing protection?
What year begin the founding of New Haven Harbor?
Where did the settlers came from?
What was the name of the Native Americans that sold them the land?
In comparison to Massachusetts what where settlers hoping to establish in New Haven Harbor?
Who was the religious leader that lead the pilgrims to New Haven Harbor?

context: In <a0_0>1637<a0_0/> a small party of Puritans reconnoitered the New Haven harbor area and wintered over. In April <a3_0><a5_0>1638<a5_0/><a3_0/>, the main party of five hundred Puritans who left the <a1_0><a6_0>Massachusetts Bay Colony<a6_0/><a1_0/> under the leadership of the <a2_0><a9_0>Reverend John Davenport<a9_0/><a2_0/> and the London merchant Theophilus Eaton sailed into the harbor. These settlers were hoping to establish a (in their mind) <a8_0>better theological community<a8_0/>, with the government more closely linked to the church than the one they left in Massachusetts and sought to take advantage of the excellent port capabilities of the harbor. The <a4_0><a7_0>Quinnipiacs<a4_0/>,<a7_0/> who were under attack by neighboring Pequots, sold their land to the settlers in return for protection.
